description: This course engages in an in-depth study of Spanish and Colonial Spanish American culture(s) from the Pre-Roman period through the 17th century. Among the topics included are: Islamic Spain, the Spanish Reconquista, the Inquisition, the Origins of the Spanish Language, Sephardic Culture in Spain, the Pilgrimage Route to St.James, Picaresque Literature, Golden Age Spanish Drama, pre-Columbian Civilizations, the Conquest of the New World, and the establishment of colonial rule in Spanish America.
name: EARLY HISP LIT & CULTURE: Citizens and Outcasts in Latin American Cinema

section.name: EARLY HISP LIT & CULTURE: Citizens and Outcasts in Latin American Cinema

values.name: EARLY HISP LIT & CULTURE: Citizens and Outcasts in Latin American Cinema
